entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Before you get excited in the wrong direction, this has nothing to do with the Apache Maven. This is the first and admittedly very small edition of the Perl Maven Cookbook. This is also the announcement of the Perl Maven web site I have been planning (and not developing) for half a year now. The Cookbook is given exclusively (and free of charge) to the people who subscribe to the Perl Maven newsletter.
entries.title: Perl Maven Cookbook

entries.text: On behalf of The Perl Foundation, Josh McAdams announced the call for venue for next year's YAPC::NA.
entries.title: YAPC::NA 2013 Call For Venue

entries.text: The French Perl Workshop will take place on 29-30 June, 2012, in Strasbourg. Talks are preferred in French but English is also accepted.
entries.title: French Perl Workshop 2012: Call for Papers

entries.text: It will be held between 19-20 October 2012 in Sao Paulo, Brasil. - I've never been to Brasil :)
entries.title: YAPC Brasil 2012 - The Revolution of Data

entries.text: For a long time I have not heard anything about mod_perl. I was not actively looking for it either, so I am not sure if there was no new or if they were just very shy. I was happy to see the announcement by Fred Moyer with all the changes that went into this version.
entries.title: mod_perl 2.0.6 released

entries.author: alberto_simoes
entries.text: Alberto Simoes publish The Perl Foundation grant proposals. They are waiting for your feedback!
entries.title: 2012Q2 Grant Proposals

entries.text: After a long break genehack (John SJ Anderson) is back writing. Telling his journey that started with a bug in Git::Wrapper went through Dist::Zilla, landed at Emacs configuration. The nice thing is that instead of abandoning the whole yak, he actually managed to shave it, went back and solved the original problem too.
entries.title: Yak Butter Makes The Best Shaving Cream

entries.author: reini_urban
entries.text: Reini Urban took several modules (eg. Moose, Module::Build, DateTime::TimeZone, Dancer), and checked their sizes after static compilation of every C code they need. some surprising results there and some interesting comments.
entries.title: Big module sizes

entries.text: Sqitch is a new tool by David Wheeler that will help you manage the changes in SQL in a way similar to how VCS-es work. We are lucky to be able to follow the development of the tool.
entries.title: Sqitch Status: A Step at a Time

entries.text: Is programming complex? Should we expect everyone to use strict; use warnings and know how to use a hash before they can ask any question? How should we help others to start programming? All this in he usual, opinionated style of chromatic.
entries.title: Smoothing the Condescending Onramp

entries.text: AEvar Arnfjoro Bjarmason tells us that you don't always want Moose to throw an exception when an invalid value is passed to a setter method. Sometimes you might want to silently accept the bad value or fall back to some default. With or without warning.
entries.title: Tweaking what Moose does when a type constraint fails

entries.text: MooX::Options makes it easy to create command line tools. Despite its name, it works with Mo, Moo, Mouse, Moose and more. By Geistteufel (Celogeek).
entries.title: Perl MooX::Options v1.2 release

entries.author: reini_urban
entries.text: Mr. Muskrat using a shell script to brew several versions of perl and Reini Urban points to perlall.
entries.title: perlbrew and tmux

entries.text: Uwe Voelker has started to built native Perl interfaces Interactive Brokers Traders Workstation (IB TWS) API.
entries.title: Perl Finance - announcing AnyEvent::TWS and Protocol::TWS

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: What happens if you load Any::Moose and then some other module loads Moose? Will it break? What does Sawyer X suggest?
entries.title: Priorities when using Any::Moose, and what Mouse people should do

entries.text: Chris Grau explores web scraping with the good old WWW::Mechanize and HTML::DOM and then re-implements the same using Mojo::UserAgent and finally using WWW::Scripter. It's interesting to compare the three solutions.
entries.title: Automating On Call Jury Instructions

entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: A nice example by Sinan Unur showing usage of perl + HTML + CSS (setting the width style attributes by the template). In the script he is using /x \A and \Z in regexes and it really is nice.
entries.title: Generate pretty weekly schedule charts using HTML::Template

entries.text: Jonathan Swartz explains that memoization is basically caching and then shows the memoize module CHI::Memoize of his CHI cache.
entries.title: Memoize: Revisiting a twelve year old API

entries.text: Mark McCracken is mostly a C++ programmer but this time he had to use JavaScript to check himself into FourSquare and then he is using Perl and a bunch of CPAN modules to monitor his long running scripts on an IRC channel. He also has a nice CPAN logo.
entries.title: JavaScript, Perl, IRC, and FourSquare

entries.author: buddy_burden
entries.text: Buddy Burden is using the lazy option of the Moose attributes as a cache.
entries.title: Lazy == Cache ?

entries.author: sebastian_willing
entries.text: Using Perl and some other glue Sebastian Willing explains how to create a crossword puzzle in German. I guess you could apply the same method in other languages as well.
entries.title: Creating a crossword puzzle

entries.text: Sergey Zasenko (und3f) is playing music using Perl and Audio::Beep and MIDI::ALSA
entries.title: Joy of an internal speaker

entries.text: Ynon Perek gave a fun presentation about Perl Golf at the last Israel.pm meeting. These are his slides.
entries.title: Perl Golf

entries.author: herbert_breunung
entries.text: If you don't know anything about Perl 6 this might be a good chance to both learn about it and contribute to its documentation. Check out the call of Herbert Breunung (lichtkind) to work on the Perl 6 tablets.
entries.title: Help to write Perl 6 Documentation

entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: 'DBIish, the new database interface for Rakudo Perl 6, now has a working SQLite backend.' writes Moritz Lenz.
entries.title: SQLite support for DBIish

chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on on the web site. If your Perl event is not in the list, let me know.
chapters.title: Events

header: Tomorrow I am flying to Kiev to attend the Perl Mova Workshop on 12-13 May 2012. Check out the link at the bottom of to see the details about this workshop. I'll be back home on the 14th only, meaning I'll send the next issue from Kiev.
I have been dragging the creation of the Perl Maven web site for too long but finally, a few days ago I did it. See the details below.
I have also added links for social sharing to the newsletter. I hope you will find this useful and will share the articles you find intersting with your followers.
Oh and I am sorry for talking so much about my stuff, I am just too excited that finally made it that far with the Perl Maven :)
subject: Announcing the new Perl Maven web site and the Perl Maven Cookbook
